definition: chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character

sentences.english: Michael Vick is being indicted again for staging dogfights.
sentences.chinese: 邁克爾Vick由於籌劃鬥狗再次遭到起訴。

sentences.english: It now plans to build more pitches for students to play on.
sentences.chinese: 現在他們正在籌劃建立更多的場地供學生們踢球。

sentences.english: HAGEE: That it was a city that was planning a sinful conduct, yes .
sentences.chinese: 那是一個籌劃着罪孽行爲的城市，是的。

sentences.english: A few days before the election, I went down to New York for a long-planned fund-raiser.
sentences.chinese: 選舉日前幾天，我去紐約參加一個籌劃已久的籌款會。

sentences.english: To get anywhere, you need to be constructive. You have to make an effort.
sentences.chinese: 不論走到何種地步，都要積極籌劃，付諸努力。

sentences.english: Experts say that while rotational grazing can save money over time , it also requires planning.
sentences.chinese: 專家稱，雖然輪牧經濟省錢，它也需要周密籌劃。

sentences.english: Why do I sit down and devise schemes and invent plans?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我呆坐着設計籌劃呢？

sentences.english: ETD leads to both micro-cosmic and macro-cosmic effects.
sentences.chinese: 企業稅務籌劃會產生宏觀和微觀雙重效應。

sentences.english: But can education ever be mapped out in such prescriptive terms?
sentences.chinese: 但是教育真的可以被那樣一板一眼地籌劃嗎？

sentences.english: Within Shanghai, there are two Metro linesand several more at the planning stages.
sentences.chinese: 上海市內已有兩條城鐵，正在籌劃建設更多線路。

sentences.english: Sometimes it takes decidedly circuitous routes in planning our demise.
sentences.chinese: 有時候她果斷而迂迴曲折地籌劃對我們的謀殺計劃。

sentences.english: Tax planning is different from tax avoidance and tax evasions.
sentences.chinese: 納稅籌劃不同於避稅和偷稅。

sentences.english: Common planning a blade etc FaChang and rescue the knife grain rob dragon.
sentences.chinese: 刀鋒等人共同籌劃着劫法場，救出刀紋龍。

sentences.english: I'm planning out the school debate.
sentences.chinese: 我正在籌劃學校辯論會。
德凡正在籌劃一場婚禮。

sentences.english: Song had worked at the same job for four years and had a project in mind when he quit.
sentences.chinese: 宋浩一份工作做了4年而且辭職的時候還有籌劃。

definition: to design/to plot/to plan out/to compose/to draw a mental sketch/conception/plan/idea/composition
variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
variant of 籌劃|筹划[chou2 hua4]
to plot/to scheme/to bring about/to engineer/planning/producer/planner
for this reason/with regards to this/in this respect/in order to do this/to this end
to unfold/to carry out/to be in full swing/to launch
